content.description:
O Danaum fortissime gentis 
TydideTydides, -ae, m.: Diomedes (a Greek warrior and the son of Tydeus)! Mene IliacisIliacus, -a, -um, adj. = Troianus, -a, -um occumbereoccumbo, -ere = cado, -ere campis 
non potuisse, tuaque animam hanc effundere dextra?
content.question: In line 3, tua dextra specifies

choices.label: who might have killed the speaker
why the speaker might have been killed
how the speaker might have been killed
where the speaker might have been killed

content.answer: how the speaker might have been killed

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2

skill.text: 1.B: Describe how grammar contributes to the meaning and function of Latin words and phrases in context.
